trans-unit.source: Normally, you can simply work with the interfaces for javax.sql.DataSource, javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource, and javax.sql.XADataSource, as shown in the following examples.

seg-source.mrk: Normally, you can simply work with the interfaces for javax.sql.DataSource, javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource, and javax.sql.XADataSource, as shown in the following examples.

target.mrk: Normally, you can simply work with the interfaces for javax.sql.DataSource, javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource, and javax.sql.XADataSource, as shown in the following examples.

trans-unit.source: // If your application is running on the Java SE 6 platform, // and if you would like to call DataSource methods specific // to the JDBC 4 API (for example, isWrapperFor), use the // JDBC 4 variants of these classes: // // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource40 // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource40 // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedXADataSource40 // import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource; import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource; import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedXADataSource; javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource cpds = new EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource(); javax.sql.DataSource ds = new EmbeddedDataSource(); javax.sql.XADataSource xads = new EmbeddedXADataSource();

seg-source.mrk: // If your application is running on the Java SE 6 platform, // and if you would like to call DataSource methods specific // to the JDBC 4 API (for example, isWrapperFor), use the // JDBC 4 variants of these classes: // // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource40 // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource40 // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedXADataSource40 // import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource; import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource; import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedXADataSource; javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource cpds = new EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource(); javax.sql.DataSource ds = new EmbeddedDataSource(); javax.sql.XADataSource xads = new EmbeddedXADataSource();

target.mrk: // If your application is running on the Java SE 6 platform, // and if you would like to call DataSource methods specific // to the JDBC 4 API (for example, isWrapperFor), use the // JDBC 4 variants of these classes: // // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource40 // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource40 // org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedXADataSource40 // import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource; import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource; import org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedXADataSource; javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource cpds = new EmbeddedConnectionPoolDataSource(); javax.sql.DataSource ds = new EmbeddedDataSource(); javax.sql.XADataSource xads = new EmbeddedXADataSource();

trans-unit.source: provides six properties for a DataSource. These properties are in org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource. They are:

This mandatory property must be set. It identifies which database to access. To access a database named wombat located at /local1/db/wombat, call setDatabaseName("/local1/db/wombat") on the data source object.

seg-source.mrk: This mandatory property must be set.
It identifies which database to access.
To access a database named wombat located at /local1/db/wombat, call setDatabaseName("/local1/db/wombat") on the data source object.

target.mrk: This mandatory property must be set.
It identifies which database to access.
To access a database named wombat located at /local1/db/wombat, call setDatabaseName("/local1/db/wombat") on the data source object.

trans-unit.source: Optional. Sets a property to create a database the next time the getConnection method of a data source object is called. The string createString is always "create" (or possibly null). (Use the method setDatabaseName() to define the name of the database.)

seg-source.mrk: Sets a property to create a database the next time the getConnection method of a data source object is called.
The string createString is always "create" (or possibly null).
(Use the method setDatabaseName() to define the name of the database.)

target.mrk: Sets a property to create a database the next time the getConnection method of a data source object is called.
The string createString is always "create" (or possibly null).
(Use the method setDatabaseName() to define the name of the database.)

trans-unit.source: Optional. Sets a property to shut down a database. The string shutDownString is always "shutdown" (or possibly null). Shuts down the database the next time the getConnection method of a data source object is called.

seg-source.mrk: Sets a property to shut down a database.
The string shutDownString is always "shutdown" (or possibly null).
Shuts down the database the next time the getConnection method of a data source object is called.

target.mrk: Sets a property to shut down a database.
The string shutDownString is always "shutdown" (or possibly null).
Shuts down the database the next time the getConnection method of a data source object is called.

trans-unit.source: Optional. Name for ConnectionPoolDataSource or XADataSource. Not used by the data source object. Used for informational purposes only.

seg-source.mrk: Not used by the data source object.

target.mrk: Not used by the data source object.

trans-unit.source: Optional. Description of the data source. Not used by the data source object. Used for informational purposes only.

seg-source.mrk: Not used by the data source object.

target.mrk: Not used by the data source object.

trans-unit.source: Optional. Connection attributes specific to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>. See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph></cite> for a more information about the attributes.

seg-source.mrk: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph></cite> for a more information about the attributes.

target.mrk: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph></cite> for a more information about the attributes.
